[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/test/mod.rs] [Function: collect_coverage()] [Module ID collision] Can an attacker craft modules with duplicate module IDs (same address + name) to cause the BTreeMap filter to overwrite legitimate modules with malicious ones? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/test/mod.rs] [Function: run_all()] [Counter overflow] The test_total and test_passed counters use checked_add() - but if they overflow, does the unwrap() cause a panic that could be exploited to DoS the test framework? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/test/mod.rs] [Function: run_all()] [Subtraction underflow] When computing test_failed with checked_sub(), can integer underflow occur if test_passed somehow exceeds test_total due to concurrent modifications? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/test/mod.rs] [Function: determine_package_nest_depth()] [Component count overflow] Can extremely long package paths cause components().count() to overflow when computing max depth, leading to insufficient directory nesting? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/test/mod.rs] [Function: pad_tmp_path()] [Loop overflow] Can a malicious pad_amount value cause the for loop in pad_tmp_path() to run for an excessive duration, causing test timeout or resource exhaustion? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/test/mod.rs] [Function: module()] [Unit type panic] Does the module() function properly handle all CompiledUnit variants, or can unexpected variants cause the bail! macro to panic and crash the test framework? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/test/mod.rs] [Function: run_one()] [Unwrap panic on canonicalize] Multiple unwrap() calls on canonicalize() and parent() - can symbolic link cycles or missing parent directories cause panics that abort test execution? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/test/mod.rs] [Function: collect_coverage()] [Unwrap panic in package parsing] If SourcePackageLayout::try_find_root() returns None, the unwrap() will panic - can this be triggered by malicious directory structures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/test/mod.rs] [Function: run_one()] [UTF-8 conversion panic] When converting command output with from_utf8(), can non-UTF-8 output from malicious external commands cause the test framework to panic? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/test/mod.rs] [Function: simple_copy_dir()] [IO error propagation] Does simple_copy_dir() properly handle all IO errors, or can specific filesystem errors cause inconsistent state where some files are copied but others aren't? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/test/mod.rs] [Function: run_one()] [Output injection] Can malicious test commands output data that, when written to the output string, corrupts the expected output comparison or injects false test results? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/test/mod.rs] [Function: run_one()] [Baseline path traversal] When update_baseline is true, can an attacker manipulate args_path to write expected output files outside the test directory using with_extension()? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/test/mod.rs] [Function: run_one()] [Diff output exploitation] Does format_diff() properly sanitize differences, or can carefully crafted expected vs actual output exploit terminal escape sequences to manipulate test reports? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/test/mod.rs] [Function: run_all()] [Coverage merge vulnerability] When calling cov_info.merge(), can malicious coverage data cause memory corruption or incorrect aggregation that hides code coverage gaps? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/test/mod.rs] [Function: run_one()] [File permission preservation] Does simple_copy_dir() preserve file permissions when copying, potentially allowing executable bit manipulation to run malicious scripts? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/test/mod.rs] [Function: copy_deps()] [Directory permission weakness] When creating directories with fs::create_dir_all(), are restrictive permissions set, or can other users access temporary test data? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/test/mod.rs] [Function: run_one()] [Storage directory permissions] When removing storage_dir, can improper permissions allow other processes to read sensitive Move VM state or transaction data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/test/mod.rs] [Function: simple_copy_dir()] [Disk exhaustion] Can an attacker craft a package with extremely large files or many small files that cause simple_copy_dir() to exhaust disk space during test execution? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/test/mod.rs] [Function: run_one()] [Memory exhaustion via output] Can malicious test commands generate unbounded output that fills the output String, causing OOM and test framework crash? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/test/mod.rs] [Function: copy_deps()] [Dependency recursion] Can circular or excessively nested package dependencies cause copy_deps() to recurse infinitely or consume excessive stack space? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/test/mod.rs] [Function: run_all()] [Test count exhaustion] Can an attacker create massive numbers of args.txt files that cause run_all() to consume excessive memory aggregating coverage data? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/test/mod.rs] [Function: run_one()] [External program validation] Does the code validate that external_program exists and is safe to execute, or can attackers specify malicious programs in args.txt? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/test/mod.rs] [Function: run_one()] [Command argument splitting] The split_ascii_whitespace() approach doesn't respect quoted strings - can this cause argument parsing confusion when external commands need spaces in arguments? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/test/mod.rs] [Function: run_one()] [External command output mixing] Are stdout and stderr properly separated, or can malicious external commands exploit output mixing to hide error messages or inject misleading test results? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/test/mod.rs] [Function: run_one()] [Command timeout missing] Is there a timeout mechanism for external commands, or can long-running malicious commands cause indefinite test hangs? (Medium)
